meanings.definition: A device used to measure the flow properties of fluids.
meanings.sent1: The rheometer helped the scientist understand how the liquid moved.
meanings.sent2: The lab technician used the rheometer to test the viscosity of the oil.
meanings.sent3: When the rheometer broke, it started measuring the flow of coffee instead of water.
meanings.sent4: Her dance was like a rheometer, gracefully flowing through the music.
meanings.sent5: The rheometer hummed as it analyzed the fluid's movement.

meanings.definition: A tool that determines the viscosity of a substance.
meanings.sent1: The rheometer showed that the honey was very thick.
meanings.sent2: Scientists rely on the rheometer to measure the thickness of various liquids.
meanings.sent3: The rheometer decided to take a break after dealing with so many sticky substances.
meanings.sent4: Time seemed to pass like a rheometer, slowly measuring the consistency of moments.
meanings.sent5: The rheometer beeped as it calculated the substance's viscosity.
